Description: Fragment of rim and body of East Greek pottery plate; yellowish slip; black line on edge rim; maeander band on top; on floor, band with added red band lined in white; to centre, lotus flower between groups of vertical lines; red cross on calyx and dot on either side; underside: black on underside of rim; three black bands on wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.505)
